title: Avera Smokers Light A Fire With Neighbors
text:
Avera Smokers Light A Fire With Neighbors October 20, 2015, 5:00 PM by Don Jorgensen SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
Some Sioux Falls neighbors are fed up with smokers and say enough is enough."I talked to one lady and I said, 'You know, how about you give me your address and I'll come over to your house and I'll dump cigarette butts in front of your home and see how you like it?'" Tru Boyer said. 
Frustrations are smoldering in one Sioux Falls neighborhood near the Avera Health Hospital. 
For years, smokers from Avera Health have gone across the street to light up because Avera is a smoke-free campus. But at the same time, they've lit a fire under the neighbor's feet and they're taking a stand. But one local builder hopes to snuff out everyone's concerns. 
On any given day, you will find some Avera employees smoking in front of this unoccupied house that's owned by Avera on the corner of 20th Street and 7th Avenue. 
Cigarette butts litter the sidewalks. 
Boyer lives right next door and is fed up with the smokers and the mess they leave behind. 
"I've had confrontations with them. I've come out and taken pictures of them; told them I'd take them across the street if they couldn't move down," Boyer said. 
Boyer has even posted a no smoking sign in her front lawn, which she says they've taken down. 
"I just stick it back in the ground and just smile at them and tell them, 'Have a wonderful day,'" Boyer said. 
Gary Carter lives down the street a few houses away and says he sees the smokers constantly. 
"If it was my house I'd chase them off because I don't like cigarette butts," Carter said. 
This ongoing problem may have a simmering solution. 
Builder John Koch has offered Avera a couple of options for the house. 
"One option would be Avera sells me the house and then my crews come in and restore that home and we'll create a nice rental property here," Koch said. 
The other option Koch offered is to hire him to remodel it for Avera and they can rent it out or auction it off. 
"I'd like to see it stay. Structurally, I think the house is in good shape; it's a beautiful home," Koch said. 
But according to neighbors, the cigarette butts discarded on the sidewalks in this neighborhood aren't so beautiful. 
"This is a neighborhood; we all live here and sleep here. Avera has two places right up the street on their property that they can make a smoking place for their people that makes Avera not the good neighbor," Boyer said. 
Avera issued this statement to KELOLAND News: "The property at S. 7th Ave. and 20th St. has been owned by Avera for many years and uninhabited for the past seven. The structure itself is not habitable without major renovation. While Avera is open to selling the house structure, we want to make sure that we have appropriate information for any potential buyer about the structure. We are conducting an inspection and expect that information to be available to us in the next month. This property is part of our Avera McKennan Hospital and University Health Center campus sitting adjacent to our Emergency Department. Avera will maintain ownership of the land. While we have no definite future plans for the lot, we can say that we will not allow smoking on this property. Avera went smoke-free more than 10 years ago. We do know we want to improve the aesthetics of the property, and we look forward to working with the community." Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
